# vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss

[![Get package from npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss?logo=npm&logoColor=white&style=flat&label=)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss) [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/@erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss?color=blue&label=&logoColor=white&style=flat&logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss) [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dw/@erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss?color=blue&label=&logoColor=white&style=flat&logo=data:image/svg%2bxml;base64,)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss) [![views](https://views.erbek.space/api/views.svg?id=github.com%2Ferbelion%2Fvite-plugin-laravel-purgecss)](https://views.erbek.space/page/?id=github.com%2Ferbelion%2Fvite-plugin-laravel-purgecss)

A [Vite](https://github.com/vitejs/vite) plugin that integrates [PurgeCSS](https://github.com/FullHuman/purgecss) with [Laravel 11/10/9](https://github.com/laravel/laravel) template assets (currently updated to laravel/laravel@11.4.0).

It purges assets only in production mode (`yarn build`/`npm run build`).

## üì¶ Installation

**yarn**

```
yarn add @erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss
```

**npm**

```
npm i @erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss
```

## üöÄ Usage

Use plugin in your Vite config (`vite.config.ts`)

```
import purge from '@erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss'

export default {
    plugins: [
        laravel(...),
        purge()
    ]
}
```

**[See more examples](#-other-examples)**

## üõ†Ô∏è Options

| Parameter        | Type                          | Optional | Description                                                                                                                            |
| ---------------- | ----------------------------- | -------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| paths            | `string[]`                    | yes      | List of paths to be processed by PurgeCSS.                                                                                             |
| PurgeCSS Options | `Partial<UserDefinedOptions>` | yes      | PurgeCSS options [(see docs)](https://purgecss.com/configuration.html#options).                                                        |
| templates        | `string[]`                    | yes      | ‚ùå deprecated [(see anyway)](https://github.com/erbelion/vite-plugin-laravel-purgecss/blob/main/src/deprecated/DEPRECATED-OPTIONS.md). |

### `paths` option

If `paths` option isn't specified, it will default to:
`resources/{js,views}/**/*.{blade.php,svelte,vue,html}`

### All options

```
type Options = {

  // plugin options
  paths?: string[]
  templates?: string[] // ‚ùå deprecated

  // purgecss options
  defaultExtractor?: ExtractorFunction
  extractors?: Array<Extractors>
  fontFace?: boolean
  keyframes?: boolean
  output?: string
  rejected?: boolean
  rejectedCss?: boolean
  stdin?: boolean
  stdout?: boolean
  variables?: boolean
  safelist?: UserDefinedSafelist
  blocklist?: StringRegExpArray
}
```

## üí° Other examples

**Via custom path:**

```
purge({
    paths: ['resources/{js,views}/**/*.{blade.php,svelte,vue,html}']
})
```

**Via custom paths + always keep `#bruh`, `.nice-button` and `h1` styling:**

```
purge({
    paths: [
        'resources/views/**/*.blade.php',
        'resources/{js,views}/**/*.vue'
    ],
    safelist: ['bruh', 'nice-button', 'h1']
})
```

**Example config with fix for escaped prefixes (`sm:`, `lg:`, etc.):**

```
purge({
    extractors: [
        {
            extractor: (content) => {
                return content.match(/[a-z-_:\/]+/g) || []
            },
            extensions: ['php', 'vue', 'html']
        }
    ]
})
```
